info.name: Fetch Multi-Item Order
info.description:
# Purpose

One-time or recurring donations made through GoFundMe Pro can have multiple items associated with them. These items can be used to track what the donor is contributing to. This Postman collection demonstrates how to retrieve those items which are associated with a transaction for one-time donations or a single transaction per recurring donation made in the same order.

This collection will not modify any data in your account, only retrieve information that already exists. You can utilize the Mock Server to gain an understanding of how this data can be retrieved. More information about using the Mock Server is [further down in this README](#mock-server).

# How to use

For instructions on how to import this collection and environment variables, refer to the [README.md](https://github.com/classy-org/postman-collections/blob/main/README.md#classy-api-postman-collections) file at the root of this repository.

Once this collection has been imported into your workspace, please refer to the documentation contained within the `README` to understand which calls to make.

## Using the Mock Server

Along with being able to plug in your credentials to make calls to the GoFundMe Pro API, this collection also has a mock server that goes along with it. To use the mock server to make requests and get back some faked data, ensure you import and use the `GoFundMe Pro API Mock Server - Fetch Multi-Item Order` environment!

item.name: Authentication

exec: tests["Response time is less than 1000ms"] = responseTime < 1000;

request.description:
### POST /oauth2/auth

This endpoint is used to authenticate and obtain an access token.

#### Request Body
- `client_id` (string): The client ID for authentication.
- `client_secret` (string): The client secret for authentication.
- `grant_type` (string): The type of grant being requested.

#### Response
The response is a JSON object with the following properties:
- `access_token` (string): The access token obtained after successful authentication.
- `expires_in` (number): The duration in seconds for which the access token is valid.
- `queries_log` (array): An array of log entries for the queries made during the authentication process.
- `token_type` (string): The type of token being returned.

#### Example Response
```json
{
    "access_token": "",
    "expires_in": 0,
    "queries_log": [],
    "token_type": ""
}
```

#### JSON Schema
```json
{
    "type": "object",
    "properties": {
        "access_token": {"type": "string"},
        "expires_in": {"type": "number"},
        "queries_log": {"type": "array"},
        "token_type": {"type": "string"}
    }
}

item.description: This folder contains any requests that authenticate your credentials with the GoFundMe Pro API. Ensure you run this request to get a valid token before attempting to run other requests in this collection.

item.name: Fetch Multi-Item Order

exec: pm.test("Response time is less than 2000ms", function () {
pm.test("Items array is present in the response", function () {

request.description:
### Get Transaction with related items

This endpoint retrieves a specific transaction along with its items.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{url}}/{{version}}/transactions/{{transaction_id}}?with=items`

response.name: Success

item.name: Get Recurring Donation Plan Transactions with Items

exec: pm.test("Response time is less than 2000ms", function () {
pm.test("Items array is present in the response", function () {

query.description: Optional; This parameter defines associated data that we can retrieve when fetching this entity. Review our API documentation for a list on supported values for this and other endpoints

request.description:
### Get Recurring Donation Plan Transactions with related items

This endpoint retrieves a list of transactions belonging to a recurring donation plan along with its items.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{url}}/{{version}}/transactions/{{transaction_id}}?with=items`

response.name: Success

query.description: Optional; This parameter defines associated data that we can retrieve when fetching this entity. Review our API documentation for a list on supported values for this and other endpoints

item.description: This folder contains all requests that allow you to get transactions with associated items. Ensure you have run an Authentication request to have a valid token before trying to run any of these!
